page.title: 16HATCH COURT I
page.content: Hatch Court is an eighteenth century mansion built of bathstone in the Palladian style. On the south front there are five arches and the roof has four pyramidal towers. In the hall, there is a very spectacular staircase made of portland stone. There are also huge Ionic columns and a massive oak table with matching benches. In the drawing room, there is a big bay window that looks out onto the garden and pool. There is also a nineteenth century sideboard and a nice equestrian painting. In the library, which used to be part of the drawing room, there are lots of books and three unusual corner cabinets.
